174.article_body: Reacting to the probe ordered by the Karnataka government into the Bible row in the state, Bengaluru's Archbishop Peter Machado said, "I feel very hurt." "No student of any other religion had converted while studying in Christian schools," he added. He further said non-Christian students were not required to read the Bible and no Bible instructions were issued for them.

175.title: SSB Jawan blackmails, rapes 24-yr-old woman in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
175.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have booked a Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) jawan for allegedly raping a 24-year-old woman in Lakhimpur Kheri. The woman alleged that the jawan took her photos while she was bathing and also recorded a video of her in the bathroom. He blackmailed her and forced her to have sexual relations with him, she claimed in her complaint.

176.title: Panchkula woman trying to book chopper tickets online cheated of ₹2.2 lakh
176.article_body: A Panchkula resident was cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by a fraudster while trying to book a helicopter ride for Char Dham Yatra with her family. The complainant said she came across a website and submitted her contact details there. "We were told to pay 50% of ticket charges in advance and remaining amount two days before chopper ride," she stated.

177.title: Will wait for NTAGI's suggestion to vaccinate 5 to 12-year-olds: Govt
177.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said the Centre will wait for National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation's (NTAGI) recommendation to begin vaccination of 5-12-year-olds. This comes after Biological E's Corbevax and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin received emergency use authorisation for children aged 5-12 and 6-12 respectively. Vaccination for minors in India began on January 3.

178.title: If Pant is an MS Dhoni fan, he should learn from him: Virender Sehwag
178.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said DC captain Rishabh Pant should learn from former CSK captain MS Dhoni, if he is a fan of Dhoni. "Pant has the ability to score 20-25 runs in the final over, but for that he has to be at the crease," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 188 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

179.title: 33-yr-old BSF constable shoots himself dead in Chhattisgarh's Kanker
179.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The incident took place on Thursday morning at the BSF camp in Kamtera, police added. "On hearing the gunshot, his colleagues rushed to the spot and found him lying dead in a pool of blood," police stated.

180.title: US is 'out of pandemic phase' of COVID-19: Anthony Fauci
180.article_body: Top US health expert Dr Anthony Fauci said the US is "out of the pandemic phase" of COVID-19. "We are much, much better off than we were a year ago," Fauci said. "There's a lot of viral dynamics throughout the world and we still may get another variant which could lead to another potential surge," he added.

181.title: Air India's four Boeing 747 jets used for VIP travel deregistered
181.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has deregistered four Boeing 747 jumbo jets of Tata-owned Air India. DGCA said if Air India wants to use these aircrafts again for commercial flights, they'll have to undergo a return-to-service programme for re-registration. Till about two years ago, these 30-year-old jets were being used by the President, Vice President and Prime Minister.

182.title: Weren't told one religion will get preferential treatment in India: Omar
182.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah said, "When we decided to accede to India, we acceded to a country where every religion would be treated equally. We were not told that one religion will get preferential treatment and others will be suppressed." He added that decision perhaps would have been different if people knew about it.

183.title: Delhi's Benito Juarez Marg underpass to be opened in May: Sisodia
183.article_body: Benito Juarez Marg underpass will be opened to the public next month, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said after he reviewed work on the stretch near South Campus. Once completed, the 1.8 km-long underpass is expected to provide relief to nearly 2.5 lakh commuters and travel to the airport and Gurugram will become smooth and traffic-free.

184.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Delhi; 7 arrested
184.article_body: A sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa and massage parlour has been busted in Delhi's East Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. After receiving a tip-off, police carried out a raid at the massage parlour, 'The Space Spa', and arrested seven persons, including five women. Police have also recovered obscene material from the spot.

185.title: Pune ZP primary education dept to give 15% fee waiver to students
185.article_body: The primary education department of Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) on Tuesday issued a notification stating that it will implement a 15% fee waiver for the academic year 2021-22 across all schools under its jurisdiction. Additionally, schools cannot halt online classes for a child if their parents were unable to pay the fees during the pandemic, an official said.

186.title: Had bad relationship after Romiit Raaj, realised I'm happy single: Shilpa Shinde
186.article_body: Television actress Shilpa Shinde, who was engaged to actor Romiit Raaj a few years ago said she realised she is happy being single. "After my engagement broke off...I did get into another relationship...that was very bad experience...I've realised I am happy being single...If someone asks me...where I am going or what I am doing...I can't keep answering him," she added.

187.title: SC upholds 6 years minimum age condition for Class 1 admissions in KVs
187.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected pleas challenging the raising of the minimum age required for admissions to Class 1 in Kendriya Vidyalayas to six years. The new rule will be applicable from 2022-2023 academic year. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had upheld the move by Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan, after which some parents took it up with the apex court.

188.title: Staff not available for anti-encroachment drive: Delhi Police to SDMC
188.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stating that its staff is preoccupied and not available for the anti-encroachment drive in one of its wards. "It's requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area of Sarita Vihar Police Station," police added.

189.title: Ben Stokes named England's new Test captain
189.article_body: All-rounder Ben Stokes has been appointed captain of England's Test team by the England & Wales Cricket Board. Stokes succeeds Joe Root in becoming the 81st captain of England's Test team. "I am honoured to be given the chance to lead the England Test team. This is a real privilege and I’m excited about getting started this summer," Stokes said.

190.title: Funding for football in India drops by almost 85% in 4 years due to poor performance
190.article_body: The government has slashed its funding to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) by almost 85% over the last four years, citing 'poor performance' of the team. AIFF has seen its grants under Annual Calendar of Training and Competitions (ACTC) fall from ₹30 crore for 2019-20 to ₹10 crore in 2020-21 and further down to ₹5 crore this year.

191.title: Malaika Arora shares pic showing scar on her forehead after car accident
191.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram Stories to share a picture which shows a scar on her forehead. The actress had met with a car accident on April 2 and was taken to the hospital after she received an injury near her eye. Earlier, speaking about the accident, she had said, "I was in shock...There was too much blood."

192.title: He taught for 50 yrs, doesn't own land: Padma Shri awardee's daughter on eviction
192.article_body: The daughter of 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut, who was evicted by Centre from bungalow allotted on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in the 1980s, said she was serving lunch when officials arrived. "This is how brutally you treat this legend. He taught in Delhi for 50 years, and doesn't own an inch of land anywhere," said Madhumita Raut.

193.title: Human activity is leading to more disasters: UN report
193.article_body: Human activity is leading to an increase in number of disasters worldwide, a new UN report released on Tuesday stated. According to the report, between 350 and 500 medium-sized to major disasters were recorded annually over the last two decades. Humans have put themselves into a spiral of self-destruction by heating up the climate and ignoring risks, the report stated.

194.title: Plane's tyre bursts while landing in B'luru; 150 passengers escape unhurt
194.article_body: Around 150 passengers onboard a Thai Airways plane escaped unhurt after the airplane suffered a tyre burst ​while landing at Bengaluru airport on Tuesday. The ground staff informed the flight's pilot about the faulty tyre, following which, he manoeuvred the plane into a safe landing. Subsequently, the scheduled departure of the flight from Bengaluru to Bangkok on Wednesday was cancelled.

195.title: Don't feel for me: Parag on entrepreneur's 'I feel for Twitter CEO' tweet
195.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded to an entrepreneur who had tweeted, "I feel for the current CEO of Twitter - he had all these plans and now lives with the same uncertainty of his whole team." Responding to entrepreneur Suhail Doshi, Agrawal tweeted, "Thank you but don't feel for me...What matters most is the service and the people improving it."

196.title: 7 IndiGo pilots found abusing over low salary on emergency frequency: Report
196.article_body: At least seven IndiGo pilots were allegedly found using offensive language on a frequency used for emergency communications, PTI reported. On April 9, these pilots were allegedly found using abusive language over low salaries on 121.5 MHz frequency, which is used for emergency communications only for the aircraft in distress. The DGCA has reportedly launched a probe in the matter.

197.title: 26 series were being shot when I was in Bhopal, no actor is out of work: Nawaz
197.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that the quality of web series is even worse than that of television serials but no actor is out of work these days. He said that everyone is busy and that it is a good thing. "I remember that I was shooting in Bhopal and 26 series were being shot there simultaneously," he added.

198.title: US President Joe Biden to visit South Korea, Japan in May
198.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Wednesday said President Joe Biden will travel to South Korea and Japan next month over China's growing influence in the region and new threats from nuclear-armed North Korea. Biden will separately meet with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio during his trip from May 20 to 24.

199.title: MP Mahua criticises Decathlon, says 'store insists I give my number to buy pants for dad'
199.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra complained about Decathlon store in Delhi and tweeted, "Want to buy my dad trousers for ₹1499 in CASH at Decathlon India...& manager insists I need to put in my mobile number & email ID to purchase." Stating that Decathlon is violating privacy and consumer laws, Moitra tweeted, "The sweet manager finally put in his number."

200.title: North Delhi Municipal Corporation fined ₹50 lakh over Bhalswa landfill fire
200.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh on North Delhi Municipal Corporation in connection with the fire that broke out at Bhalswa landfill site. Notably, some areas of the landfill are still burning on Thursday and fire tenders are present at the site. A massive fire broke out at the Bhalswa landfill on Tuesday evening.

201.title: Endangered male tiger put to sleep due to chronic back issue in UK
201.article_body: An endangered male tiger, named Vladimir, was put to sleep after a "chronic back problem suddenly worsened" at the Yorkshire Wildlife Park in the UK. The park said the "sad decision" was made by vets on Tuesday and that he would be "dearly missed". He was one of three Amur Tigers who arrived at the park 10 years ago.

202.title: Ace your preparation strategy with your trusted partner : Pearson
202.article_body: Whether aiming for higher studies or better jobs in the future, Indian learners today demand a world-class learning experience that accelerates their career pathways, said Pearson. Aligning to the idea, the brand has launched a new brand film on 'Preparation' featuring Vicky Kaushal. The film talks about how experts like Pearson can make the preparation process convenient and accessible.

203.title: Russian fleet in Black Sea still has ability to strike Ukraine: UK
203.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Thursday said Russia's fleet in the Black Sea still has the ability to strike Ukraine despite losing its landing ship Saratov and cruiser Moskva. The ministry said around 20 Russian Navy ships, including submarines, are currently in the operational zone of the Black Sea. It added that the Bosphorus Strait remains closed to non-Turkish warships.

204.title: PMPML to increase EV charging stations as more e-buses join fleet
204.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is set to increase number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations as more e-buses join its fleet. The EV charging station at Wagholi will have 35 charging points that can charge up to 70 e-buses simultaneously, PMPML chairman said. PMC is also likely to set up charging stations at Pune station and Bibwewadi depots.

205.title: India-Japan ties have deepened in every sphere in 70 years: PM Modi
205.article_body: On the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between India and Japan, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the ties between the two countries have deepened in every sphere. The recent visit to India by Japanese PM Fumio Kishida laid out a roadmap for deepening the Special Strategic and Global Partnership in a post-COVID-19 world.

206.title: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, 4 family members get clean chit in minor's molestation case
206.article_body: A special POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) court in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar has given a clean chit to actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui and four of his family members in a molestation case. According to the prosecution, Siddiqui's brother Minazuddin had allegedly molested a minor family member in 2012, while the other family members had supported him.

207.title: Switzerland implements new EU sanctions against Russia, Belarus
207.article_body: The Swiss government on Wednesday said it has implemented new EU sanctions against Russia and Belarus. The sanctions include an import ban on coal, timber, caviar and seafood which are seen as important sources of revenue for Russia. Exports of banknotes and sales of securities in all EU currencies to Belarusian nationals and residents is also banned.

208.title: I can dream of becoming UP CM again or PM but not country's President: Mayawati
208.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said SP is responsible for BJP's win in UP in the recent Assembly polls. "I can dream of becoming UP CM again or the PM but not the President of the country," Mayawati added. "SP is dreaming of making me country's President so that their path to the UP CM post is clear," Mayawati stated.

209.title: Waste pickers assaulted for dancing in religious procession in Pune
209.article_body: Two waste pickers were allegedly assaulted for dancing in a public religious procession (jatra) in Pune's Jejuri. The victims alleged that casteist remarks were made against them for dancing with the other public from the village. Following their complaint, police have launched an investigation and have booked two men under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

210.title: Video of Johnny Depp drawing during his defamation trial goes viral
210.article_body: A video of Johnny Depp doodling during his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard has gone viral on social media. In the video, Depp can be seen drawing a picture on a notepad while LAPD officer Tyler Hadden testified in court over the incident that took place in May 2016. Later, Depp was seen showing his doodle to his attorney.

211.title: Music should be heard rather than be seen: Aamir on releasing 'Kahani' on radio
211.article_body: Aamir Khan unveiled a song titled 'Kahani' from his upcoming film, 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Aamir said he released the song on a radio station because a song deserves to be heard than just be seen with the help of visuals. Speaking about the song, he said, "I...believe that the songs in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' are the soul of the film."

212.title: Germany top buyer of Russian energy since invasion began: Study
212.article_body: A study published by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA) shows that Germany has been the top buyer of Russian energy since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. The CREA said Russia has earned €63 billion from fossil fuel exports of which Germany has paid about €9.1 billion since February 24.

213.title: Especially inappropriate: Kasparov on Djokovic supporting Russian players
213.article_body: Reacting to world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic's support for Russian players, ex-Russian chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov tweeted, "Russian athletes who don't condemn Putin...are supporting [him]. A [Serbian] failing to do so is especially inappropriate." "I personally believe there is no need to suspend Russian players. Competing is their right," Djokovic had earlier said.

214.title: Reels hard to monetise despite being popular: Zuckerberg
214.article_body: Reels account for over 20% of the time that users spend on Instagram, but they're hard to monetise for now, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said during the company's Q1 2022 earnings call. He added that currently AI recommendations are driving more of user feeds than social content. This will unlock "interesting" content that users would've otherwise missed, he noted.

215.title: We're all going to die some day, nuclear strike more probable: Russian TV host
215.article_body: Amid war with Ukraine, Russian state TV host Margarita Simonyan has said that everything will end with a nuclear strike, adding, "To me, it's more probable than the other outcome." "We will go to heaven, while they (enemies) will simply croak...We're all going to die someday," she said. Simonyan further said that she thinks World War-III is more realistic.

216.title: 'Sooryavansham' appeals to people, they show it again and again: Abhishek
216.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said there is something about his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's movie 'Sooryavansham' that appeals to people. "Sooryavansham is one of the most successful films for the channel when it comes on satellite. They keep showing it again and again," he said, adding, "I think 20-21 years since its release, and it still comes on satellite television."

217.title: DC can send Shardul Thakur up the order: Virender Sehwag
217.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said he's concerned about DC's batting in IPL 2022. He added that Shaw and Warner need to play longer innings for DC to have the advantage. He further said, "You can send Shardul Thakur up the order. He hasn't been doing much with the ball...could maybe come up with useful contributions with the bat."

218.title: Police arrest 8 people for school teacher's murder in Bihar's Buxar
218.article_body: Bihar Police on Thursday arrested eight people in connection with the murder of a school teacher in Buxar. Saroj Singh, who was the main witness to his brother Chitranjan's murder, was killed on April 19. Saroj had reportedly refused to turn hostile in his brother's murder trial, following which two people were hired on contract to kill him, police said.

219.title: PM Modi lays foundation stones for healthcare, education projects in Assam
219.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid foundation stones for healthcare and education projects including a Veterinary College in Assam's Diphu, Degree College in West Karbi Anglong and Agricultural College in Kolonga on Thursday. He also addressed the public at the 'Peace, Unity and Development Rally' in Diphu and said, "Since 2014...difficulties in the North East are reducing, people are developing."

220.title: Global chipmakers evaluating sites in India for new plants: Govt
220.article_body: Some of the world's biggest chipmakers are evaluating locations in India for new plants, Communications, Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told Bloomberg Television. India is in discussion with some of the world's largest firms to attract them into the country. "India is right there squarely on their global plans whether it is Intel, GlobalFoundries," he added.

221.title: Lookout notice issued against Vijay Babu in rape case, suspected to be out of the country
221.article_body: Kerala Police has issued a lookout circular against Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu who's facing a rape case. Babu went into hiding after the police registered a case against him based on the complaint of a woman who had accused him of sexually abusing her several times in the last one and half months. Police suspect he's out of the country.

222.title: 2 more arrested in connection with Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
222.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested two more persons in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place on April 16. Police said that while scanning CCTV cameras and mobile videos, they found one accused roaming around with the crowd with a sword during the violence. The other accused was found to be instigating the crowd during the violence, police added.

223.title: Facing my first shot: Jaya Prada on throwback picture from her 1st movie
223.article_body: Actress Jaya Prada took to Instagram to share a throwback picture. "Throwback pic...Me facing my first shot in my movie," she captioned the picture. Her fans took to the comments section to say that she looks beautiful. "Too gorgeous ma'am," one fan commented while the other said, "Pic is not clear but you are clear."

224.title: J&K Police disallows Ramadan's last Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid suspecting protest
224.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has decided not to allow last Friday prayers of Ramadan at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid this year, citing difficulty in managing huge congregation. "Traditionally, it is a huge congregation and it can easily spiral into an Azadi protest," a police officer said. On April 9, 'Azadi' slogans were raised inside the mosque after the Friday prayers.

225.title: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde abused online after Musk's tweets target her
225.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde is being targeted with abusive tweets after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, criticised a content decision of Twitter's legal team. On a user's tweet about Gadde, Musk criticised Twitter's 2020 decision to block a story about Hunter Biden. Musk also tweeted a meme about Twitter's alleged "left-wing bias", which featured Gadde.

226.title: Orange warning issued for 5 states/UTs as temperatures cross 45°C; list released
226.article_body: IMD scientist RK Jenamani on Thursday said that some parts of country recorded temperatures above 45°C yesterday, adding, "In view of this, we've announced an orange warning for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha." IMD has warned about heatwave conditions over northwest and central India during the next five days and over east India during next three days.

227.title: DC players to wear special jersey against KKR tonight, share pics
227.article_body: The players of Delhi Capitals (DC) will wear a special jersey tonight in their IPL 2022 match against KKR. The special match shirts worn during the match will be auctioned off by the franchise. Every bid placed by a fan for the special match shirts will help raise funds for the Inspire Institute of Sport (IIS) Vijayanagar.

228.title: Wanted to start lingerie business 15 yrs ago, plan never saw light of day: Vineeta
228.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh wrote on LinkedIn that she wanted to start a lingerie business 15 years ago. She said, "That business plan never saw the light of day." She also wrote, "It's tough to build something. It's just a little bit tougher if you're building for women, with women as a woman."

229.title: Efforts on to remove entire northeast from AFSPA's ambit: PM Modi
229.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Centre is working to ensure that the entire northeast region is removed from the ambit of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA). He said Meghalaya and Tripura were removed from AFSPA's ambit because there has been a 75% drop in violent incidents in the region in the last eight years.

230.title: SC to hold final hearing on pleas challenging sedition on May 5
230.article_body: The Supreme Court will hold the final hearing on pleas challenging constitutional validity of the sedition law under IPC Section 124A on May 5, a bench led by CJI N V Ramana said. The bench asked the Centre to submit its response by the end of the week, after which the petitioners will be allowed to file their counter.

231.title: UK minister accused of watching porn on mobile phone in parliament, probe on
231.article_body: A UK minister has been accused of watching porn on mobile phone while sitting alongside a female member in the country's parliament. The Conservative Party's chief whip has ordered an investigation into the allegations against the minister. The UK government's safeguarding minister Rachel Maclean said that she wants to see the minister "out of parliament and out of the party".

232.title: I'll do it one day: Umran on bowling 155 kmph delivery in IPL 2022
232.article_body: On being asked if he's targeting to hit 155 kmph with the ball in the ongoing IPL season, SRH pacer Umran Malik said, "God willing if I've to bowl 155, I'll do it one day." Umran, however, also added that he's only looking to bowl well in the tournament. The 22-year-old has picked 15 wickets in eight games so far.

233.title: Man throws acid on woman for rejecting marriage proposal in Bengaluru
233.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Bengaluru allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman for rejecting his marriage proposal. The incident happened at the staircase of the victim's office building in Sunkadakatte on Thursday. The woman has reportedly sustained more than 25% burn injuries and is being treated at a hospital. Police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused, Nagesh.

234.title: 2 crushed to death, 3 injured as cars collide on Pune-Solapur highway
234.article_body: Two persons died and three others were injured after two cars collided with each other near the Kavadi Pat toll plaza on the Pune-Solapur highway on Thursday, police said. The impact of the collision was so severe that both cars were badly damaged and people inside them were crushed, police added. Meanwhile, an investigation has been launched into the incident.

235.title: Furniture startup WoodenStreet raises ₹230 cr at ₹1,200 cr valuation
235.article_body: Online furniture and home decor platform WoodenStreet has raised ₹230 crore ($30 million) at a valuation of ₹1,200 crore, the Jaipur-based D2C company announced on Wednesday. The Series B funding round was led by WestBridge Capital. The company closed Series A funding of $3 million from IAN and Rajasthan Venture Capital Funds in 2020.

236.title: I had conspiracy theories: Hiddink on Chelsea's 2nd leg vs Barcelona in 2009
236.article_body: Discussing the second leg of Chelsea's Champions League semi-final against Barcelona in 2009, Guus Hiddink who was then Chelsea's interim manager said, "Some people argued it was fixed. I started to have a few conspiracy theories." Chelsea were knocked out of the Champions League on the basis of the away goals rule, after it ended 1-1 on aggregate.

237.title: 62 terrorists killed in encounters so far this year: IGP Kashmir
237.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said 62 terrorists have been killed in encounters so far this year. Out of these, 47 were local terrorists and 15 were foreign terrorists, said Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar. While 39 of the total terrorists killed belonged to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), 15 were from Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), he added.

238.title: Putin vows 'lightning-fast' response to any foreign interference in Ukraine
238.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned if any country interferes in the ongoing Ukraine conflict it'd be met with a "lightning-fast" military response from Moscow. "We have all the tools for this, things no one else can boast of having now. And we will not boast, we will use them if necessary. And I want everyone to know that," Putin said.

239.title: 91-year-old Odissi dancer evicted, Padma Shri citation seen lying on road in Delhi
239.article_body: Centre has started evicting artistes who were allotted bungalows on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in 1980s. On Tuesday, 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut was evicted and his Padma Shri citation was seen lying on road. His daughter Madhumita said, "I'm extremely hurt and broken today...He doesn't deserve to be thrown out like this. Every citizen deserves basic dignity."

240.title: Around 5,000 active cases in Delhi but severity going down: Satyendar Jain
240.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said though the number of COVID-19 cases in the capital is increasing, its severity is going down. "There are around 5,000 active COVID cases in Delhi, but hospital admissions are very few, as the entire population of Delhi is vaccinated," he said. "We have 10,000 beds...If needed, we'll increase the number," he added.

241.title: Unfortunately in Maha, we don't have any 'yogis' but 'bhogis': Raj Thackeray
241.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray congratulated UP CM Yogi Adityanath for removing thousands of loudspeakers from religious places, "especially the masjids" in the state. "Unfortunately in Maharashtra, we don't have any 'yogis'; what we have are 'bhogis'. Here's hoping and praying good sense prevails," Thackeray said. UP government removed 10,900 "illegal" loudspeakers from religious places till Wednesday.

242.title: Ugly display of faith to harass others won’t be tolerated: UP CM Yogi
242.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it won’t be tolerated if people indulge in an "ugly display" of their faith to harass others. "There is full respect for all the faiths, there is no interference by the state government in religious practices but common people shouldn't be harassed," he added. "We proved that UP can remain free of riots," he stated.

243.title: She hit me with metal rod: Rob Kardashian on 'toxic' relationship with Blac Chyna
243.article_body: Speaking about his relationship with ex-fiancée Blac Chyna, television personality Rob Kardashian said, "It wasn't...real...love or we'd have been married. I didn't want to be married to someone like that. It was a toxic relationship." Kardashian also revealed the alleged abuse where Chyna got violent and hit him with a six-foot metal rod and pointed an unloaded gun at him.

244.title: Hair Care Juice reduces hair fall on 93% of our users in 6 weeks: Kapiva
244.article_body: According to a study conducted among Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda's consumers, 93% claim they experienced less hair fall after using Hair Care Juice. The combination of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla stimulates scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, and combats breakage & hair loss due to stress, Kapiva stated. Furthermore, 70% users experienced faster & newer hair growth.

245.title: Most pleasing thing about Umran is that he wants to learn, improve: Moody
245.article_body: Praising their pacer Umran Malik, SRH head coach Tom Moody said the most pleasing thing about the 22-year-old is that he wants to "learn and improve". Moody added, "Umran is still very new to this high-pressure cricket. I'm sure he'll gain more and more confidence in IPL." Umran picked a five-wicket haul against GT on Wednesday.

246.title: Hardik Patel not holding talks with us despite invitation: Gujarat Cong chief
246.article_body: Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor criticised Hardik Patel by saying that he is giving anti-party statements in the media and not making himself available to resolve the differences when invited for talks with party members. "I called him last week and again yesterday. Last time he said he was busy...Later, he said he was in Surat," Thakor said.

247.title: Karachi University suicide bomber's husband arrested
247.article_body: Security officials have arrested the husband of the 30-year-old woman who blew herself up at the University of Karachi in Pakistan on Tuesday. This is reportedly the first arrest in connection with the blast case. Four people, including three Chinese nationals, were killed and several others were injured in the blast claimed by the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA).

248.title: A regional language is the most important: Karnataka CM on national language debate
248.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's argument over national language debate, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "What Sudeep said was correct...A regional language is the most important as a state is formed on linguistic bases." He added, "Everyone should understand and respect what Sudeep...said." Referring to KGF: Chapter 2's success, Sudeep said Hindi is "no more" a national language.

249.title: Sickening to see the violence against Muslims celebrated in India: Padma Lakshmi
249.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi has tweeted, "Sickening to see violence against Muslims celebrated in India. The widespread anti-Muslim rhetoric...poisons people." "Fellow Hindus, don't succumb to this fear-mongering. There is no threat to Hinduism in India or anywhere else. People of all faiths should be able to live peacefully together in this ancient...land.," she wrote.

250.title: Teachers told my parents there's something wrong with me: Zerodha CEO
250.article_body: Zerodha's Billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath in an interview discussed his school days and said his teachers called his parents several times and told them that "there is something wrong with your son". Talking about taking up entrepreneurship Kamath said, "It was accidental." He added he quit his job at a call centre and started portfolio management.

251.title: CCI conducts raids against Amazon's 2 Indian sellers: Report
251.article_body: The Competition Commission of India has launched raids against two domestic Amazon sellers, Cloudtail and Appario, over alleged violation of competition laws, Reuters reported citing sources. The raids, being carried out in New Delhi and Bengaluru, are related to CCI's investigation ordered in January 2020. Earlier, Amazon had been accused of promoting preferred sellers on websites.

252.title: Haryana Police constable dies after accidentally firing his service rifle
252.article_body: A constable of Haryana Police died after he accidentally fired his service rifle at his house on Tuesday. The deceased, identified as Pitamber, reportedly came home late after duty and brought the rifle with him. Next day, he started cleaning the rifle, when it accidentally went off. Pitamber was rushed to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

253.title: Tiger Shroff, Tara Sutaria visit temple, dargah ahead of Heropanti 2 release
253.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria visited Babulnath temple and Mahim dargah in Mumbai ahead of the release of their upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Tara and Tiger carried a basket of flowers on their head as they entered the Mahim dargah. The duo donned ethnic attire as they sought blessings for the success of their forthcoming film 'Heropanti 2'.

254.title: 5 coal miners killed by gunmen in Afghanistan
254.article_body: Five coal miners were killed by unidentified gunmen in Afghanistan's Samangan province on Tuesday, according to media reports. The victims were said to be robbed before being shot by the attackers. The incident took place in the Kotal Regi area of the Dara-e-Sof district. All the victims were reportedly from the Hazara community.

255.title: Govt asks electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches due to fire incidents: Reports
255.article_body: The government has asked electric two-wheeler manufacturers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated, reports said. The government has also cautioned manufacturers who did not have incidents to take corrective measures, reports added. The makers have also been asked to recall EVs from the particular batch of vehicles that the fires were reported on recently, reports stated.

256.title: Amazon permanently lifts ban on mobile phones in warehouses: Report
256.article_body: Amazon has permanently lifted the ban on mobile phones in warehouses allowing workers to keep mobile phones with them on the job, Bloomberg reported citing an internal email. "We recognise the desire for employees to keep their mobile phones...and...last two years have demonstrated that we can safely do so," it said. The new policy will be applicable worldwide.

257.title: Maha govt collected ₹79,412 cr as fuel taxes since 2018: Hardeep Puri
257.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri took to Twitter to question the Maharashtra government's decision to not reduce Value Added Tax (VAT) on fuel. "Maharashtra...collected ₹79,412 crore...fuel taxes since 2018 and is expected to collect ₹33,000 crore this year," he stated. "Why did it not reduce VAT on petrol...diesel to provide relief to people?" he added.

258.title: Coercive, not co-operative: Rahul on PM's fuel tax appeal to states
258.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said 68% of all fuel taxes is taken by the Centre, yet, PM Narendra Modi abdicates the responsibility. "High fuel prices - blame states, coal shortage - blame states, oxygen shortage - blame states...(PM) Modi’s federalism isn't cooperative. It’s coercive," Gandhi tweeted. His remark comes after PM Modi urged several states to cut VAT on fuel.

259.title: Maha Police seizes 89 swords from vehicle on Mumbai-Agra highway, 4 held
259.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Thursday seized 89 swords and one dagger from a Scorpio vehicle, on its way from Chittorgarh in Rajasthan, on the Mumbai-Agra highway in Dhule and arrested four men. There is no clarity on where the weapons were headed to, police said. BJP leader Ram Kadam questioned why swords from a Congress-ruled state were being brought to Mumbai.

260.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood for ritual purposes: Megan Fox
260.article_body: Actress Megan Fox, speaking to Glamour magazine, opened up about she and her fiancé, singer Machine Gun Kelly, drinking each other's blood. "I guess to drink each other's blood might mislead people or people are imagining us with goblets...It's just a few drops, but yes, we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," she stated.

261.title: Pooja Hegde is social media queen, what she posts has impact: Ram Charan
261.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that actress Pooja Hegde is a social media queen and is good at it. "'Arabic Kuthu' was all over the place. We were shooting and...were waiting for next shot to set up and...I saw boys and girls...listening to 'Arabic Kuthu' and 'Butta Bomma'. It's coming out...in my Reels also...whatever Pooja posts makes an impact," he added.

262.title: Cong mute spectator to crimes against women in Rajasthan: Anurag Thakur
262.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised Congress over 'rise in crime' against women in Rajasthan. "In Hathras, the way Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi came forward and Sonia Gandhi made incessant statements...Why have Sonia ji, Rahul ji and Priyanka ji turned mute spectators now?" Thakur asked. He also accused Congress of creating tensions among different communities in Rajasthan.

263.title: UN to send team to evacuate civilians from Mariupol steel plant
263.article_body: The United Nations said that it is sending an experienced team from the world over, in partnership with International Committee of the Red Cross, to evacuate people trapped in a steel plant in Ukraine's Mariupol. About 2,000 troops and 1,000 civilians are said to be trapped in bunkers below the damaged structure.

264.title: Mohali woman with blindfold after surgery loses purse to unidentified man
264.article_body: An unidentified man took away a woman’s purse while she was waiting in her daughter’s car, blindfolded after undergoing an eye operation at Mohali’s Sohana Hospital on Wednesday. The purse contained an iPhone, Apple Watch, ₹6,000, a pair of gold earrings and bangles, besides her PAN card, Aadhaar card, bank passbook and credit card, the victim’s daughter said.

265.title: Musk says Twitter needs to be politically neutral for public trust, explains what he means
265.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who recently announced that he would buy Twitter, has said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral." He further explained that it effectively means "upsetting the far right and the far left equally". Earlier, Musk said that former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social exists because Twitter censored free speech.

266.title: Your ignorance is baffling: Ramya on Devgn's 'Hindi is national language' remark
266.article_body: Reacting to actor Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi was, is and will always be our national language' remark, actress-politician Divya Spandana, who is known as Ramya, tweeted, "No, Hindi is not our national language." She added, "Your ignorance is baffling. And it's great that films like KGF, Pushpa and RRR have done so well in Hindi belt...art has no language barrier."

267.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes third-highest grossing film in Hindi
267.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the third-highest grossing film in Hindi with a collection of ₹343 crore. It has beaten lifetime figures of Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai' ( ₹339.16 crore), Aamir Khan's 'PK' (₹340.8 crore) and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju' (₹342.53 crore). 'KGF: Chapter 2', which's originally made in Kannada, is inching towards the ₹1,000-crore mark at overall box office.

268.title: I once got angry at Pep Guardiola, we yelled in each other's faces: Aguero
268.article_body: Ex-Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero said he once got angry at Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola during a match against Tottenham Hotspur, with the two "yelling" in each other's faces. Discussing Guardiola's reaction after Riyad Mahrez missed a chance in the first leg of Manchester City's Champions League semi-final, Aguero stated he "doesn't like" Guardiola getting angry like that.

269.title: Elon Musk wins $13 bn suit over $2.6 bn Tesla-SolarCity deal
269.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won a $13 billion lawsuit over Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity, which Tesla shareholders had called a "bailout". They accused Musk of coercing Tesla's board into buying the struggling SolarCity, to rescue his investment. However, the US court found that Musk "was more involved in the process than a conflicted fiduciary should be".

270.title: BHU students burn VC's effigy in protest against Iftar party
270.article_body: In protest against the Iftar party organised by the Vice-Chancellor of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on the campus, a group of students from the university burnt his effigy outside his residence on Wednesday. "VC is trying to impose a new tradition. This has never happened before in the university. He is trying to politicise the entire situation," a student said.

271.title: No load-shedding since a week in Maharashtra: MSEDCL chairman
271.article_body: Maharashtra has seen zero load-shedding for the last seven days, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) chairman Vijay Singhal said. "We were able to meet the highest demand of 25,150 MW," he added. "We could generate additional hydro-power from the Koyna dam...has a capacity of around 100 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) for hydro-power generation," Singhal stated.

272.title: Need to prepare for 'short, swift wars': Indian Air Force chief
272.article_body: The current geopolitical situation necessitates Indian Air Force to prepare for intense and small duration operations at a short notice, Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari has said. In an address at a seminar, he also said there would be a need for the force to prepare for "short, swift wars" and be ready for "long-drawn standoff".

273.title: Tomatoes thrown at French President Macron during 1st appearance after re-election
273.article_body: Tomatoes were thrown at French President Emmanuel Macron during his first appearance in public since his re-election on Sunday. Macron was greeting people following his victory when someone from the crowd hurled tomatoes at him. The tomatoes, however, missed the French President and hit one of his security guards, who shouted "projectile".

274.title: My 1st marriage may not have worked but I haven't become anti-men: Kanika
274.article_body: Speaking about her first marriage and how she has dealt with her divorce, singer Kanika Kapoor said that she decided to go out and work after her separation. When asked about her relationship with her ex-husband, Raj Chandok, Kanika said they're cordial with each other. "My first marriage may not have worked...but I've not become anti-love or anti-men," she added.

275.title: TMC has no future in Goa: Party's state chief resigns
275.article_body: Blaming poll strategist Prashant Kishor for the upset in Assembly elections, Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar on Wednesday resigned from the party. The party has no future in Goa, he said. He added he had nothing against party chief Mamata Banerjee. "Prashant Kishor is the one who leads I-PAC. If anyone has failed, it is him," said Kandolkar.

276.title: PM called meet for COVID, taunted CMs of non-BJP states on fuel price: Raut
276.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of non-BJP ruling states to reduce VAT on fuel and said PM Modi "taunted" the CMs. "The CMs were told that PM Modi would hold a meeting on COVID...(He) was not expected to do so but CM Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee have given the answer," Raut added.

277.title: It's sent shiver down B'wood filmmakers' spine: Manoj on South films' success
277.article_body: Discussing the success of South films, actor Manoj Bajpayee said, "It has sent a shiver down the spine of all the mainstream filmmakers from the Mumbai film industry. They...don't know where to look." "This is a lesson for Mumbai industry's mainstream filmmakers on how to make mainstream cinema," added Manoj. "They don't dumb [their films]...down for the audience," stated Manoj.

278.title: It's happening so often that I fear we'll run out of luck in knockouts: Hardik
278.article_body: After their last-ball win against SRH, GT captain Hardik Pandya jokingly said "God is helping" them out in the ongoing IPL season. "I keep joking in the dressing room that God is telling us 'You guys are good, I'll help you'. It's happening so often that I fear we may run out of luck in the knockout games," he stated.

279.title: Man sleeping on roadside killed after being run over by SUV in Pune
279.article_body: A 37-year-old SUV driver has been arrested for allegedly running over and killing an elderly man sleeping on the roadside near Pune's Salisbury Park on April 20. The police arrested the accused, Anup Mehta, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. The driver told police that he wasn't able to see the man due to the vehicle's big bonnet.

280.title: People in Srinagar gather on streets to protest power crisis
280.article_body: Locals in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar gathered on the streets to protest the ongoing power crisis on Wednesday. They claimed they don't get electricity for three to four hours a day which has impacted the businessmen and industrial unitholders. "This is the first time we are witnessing such a scenario in Kashmir," said Tariq Mughloo, Vice-President, Kashmir Economic Alliance.

281.title: Army jawans booked after 3 J&K policemen get injured over dispute
281.article_body: Indian Army jawans were booked after three policemen were reportedly injured over a dispute related to some construction work in Jammu. The Army is said to have objected to the construction by a civilian family, who claimed to have permission for renovation work from the authorities. The policemen sustained injuries when they intervened. The Army denied the assault charge.

282.title: OnePlus 10R 5G, Nord CE 2 Lite 5G and Nord Buds set to be launched today
282.article_body: OnePlus presents 'More Power to You', unveiling its latest array of products across categories. The OnePlus 10R 5G will come with 150W SuperVOOC charge support and MediaTek Dimensity 8100 MA processor whereas the OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite will feature a 64MP AI triple camera setup. The new OnePlus Nord Buds will sport 12.4 mm dynamic bass drivers.

283.title: TN reduced tax on petrol before Centre's action: State Finance Min
283.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Tamil Nadu's Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan said that the Tamil Nadu government had reduced VAT on petrol back in August 2021, prior to the central government's action. "That cut resulted in a relief of ₹3/litre to the citizens of the state," the minister said.

284.title: RSS is like termite, spreading poison against society: Rajasthan Congress chief
284.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is like a "hidden termite" which is hollowing the society by spreading "poison". The Congress leader added that the RSS enjoys power behind the curtain and is not participating in direct politics to skirt accountability.

285.title: Centre owes Maha ₹26,500 cr, state not responsible for fuel price hike: Thackeray
285.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the Centre owes the state ₹26,500 crore after PM Narendra Modi stated some states did not reduce VAT on petrol and diesel despite Union government's excise duty cut. The state is not responsible for the hike in fuel prices, he added. "Maharashtra's contribution in direct taxes collection at the national level is 38.3%," Thackeray stated.

286.title: My decision to work in a film will never be based on my character's age: Mrunal
286.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who played the role of a mother in 'Jersey', said her decision to work in a film will never be based on her character's age. "It's dependent on [whether] the script resonates with me or how challenging it would be to play [an]...older version of myself," she added. "Make-up...doesn't help elevate the performances in such cases," she said.

287.title: Canada Parliament votes Russia's invasion of Ukraine as 'genocide'
287.article_body: Canadian lawmakers on Wednesday voted unanimously to call Russia's invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'. The members of the Canadian House of Commons said there was "ample evidence of systemic and massive war crimes against humanity" being committed by Russia. The motion said war crimes by Russia include mass atrocities, systematic instances of willful killing of Ukrainian civilians, and rape.

288.title: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
288.article_body: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".

289.title: Man kills 8-month pregnant relative in Mumbai, foetus dies inside womb
289.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was murdered by her husband's cousin who was staying with them since a few months in Mumbai. An official said that the woman was found dead at her home and added that the foetus also died inside her womb. The reason for killing her has not yet been ascertained. Police have arrested the accused.

290.title: 2 former Karnataka CMs reply to Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi is our national language' tweet
290.article_body: Two former Karnataka Chief Ministers Siddaramaiah and HD Kumaraswamy have responded to Ajay Devgn's tweet directed at Kannada actor Sudeep, saying Hindi is our national language. Siddaramaiah said, "Hindi was never and will never be our national language. It's the duty of every Indian to respect linguistic diversity of our country." Kumaraswamy said, "India is a garden of several languages."

291.title: Nope! we're still here: Twitter CEO Parag after user says 'I thought we were fired'
291.article_body: Responding to a user who tweeted, "I thought we were fired," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal wrote, "Nope! we're still here." Reacting to his reply, Twitter users wrote, "Hopefully, for not much longer," and "Better start looking now." Earlier, a report said Agrawal would receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

292.title: NCP leader Khadse's wife gets interim relief from arrest in land scam case
292.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted interim relief from arrest till June 20 to NCP leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Khadse in connection with the 2016 Pune land scam case. "She is arraigned as an accused in the case lodged by ED in 2019," Mandakini's advocate said. Mandakini said that this is the only case against her.

293.title: Can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Bible and Quran: K'taka Education Minister BC Nagesh
293.article_body: After a Bengaluru school allegedly made Bible reading compulsory, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Quran and Bible." He said, "Bible and Quran are religious texts. But Bhagavad Gita speaks about values needed to lead life." Earlier, Archbishop of Bengaluru questioned state government's plans to introduce Bhagavad Gita as the moral science syllabus.

294.title: RCB host Maxwell's wedding party, video of Kohli dancing on Pushpa song surfaces
294.article_body: RCB organised a wedding party in the bubble for newlyweds Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. A video of Virat Kohli dancing on Oo Antava song from movie 'Pushpa' at the wedding party has surfaced online. Anushka Sharma also shared pictures from the wedding party, writing, "I think I’ve seen and celebrated possibly every function and festival in a bubble!"

295.title: Proud of our people who are working with focus despite the noise: Twitter CEO
295.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday said, "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus...despite the noise." Earlier, Agrawal told his employees, "There are no plans for any layoffs at this point." Recently, a report claimed that Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Musk's takeover.

296.title: Exotic monkeys, wallaby rescued from 2 smugglers in Assam
296.article_body: Five exotic monkeys and a wallaby were rescued from two smugglers in Assam's North Kamrup on Wednesday. The accused were allegedly taking the caged animals to Hyderabad in a vehicle. One of the smugglers has been arrested, while the other managed to flee the spot, the forest department confirmed. The monkeys are believed to have been smuggled via Myanmar.

297.title: Corbett chief sacked, 2 IFS officers suspended over illegal construction
297.article_body: Uttarakhand government removed Rahul, the director of the Corbett Tiger Reserve and suspended two Indian Forest Service officers, JS Suhag and Kishan Chand from their posts on Wednesday. The High Court, in January, had directed to take action against the officials found guilty in the case of illegal constructions and felling of trees in the reserve's Pakhro and Morghati areas.

298.title: Liverpool defeat Villarreal to take 2-0 lead in Champions League semis
298.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 2-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final. Liverpool's Jordan Henderson's deflected effort, which was ruled as Pervis Estupinan's own goal, opened the scoring while Sadio Mane doubled the lead in a two-minute span early in the second half. Liverpool are attempting to reach their third Champions League final in five years.

299.title: I won't say so: Anil on whether he is 'best friends' with Ranveer, Sanjay
299.article_body: Discussing whether he is 'best friends' with actors Ranveer Singh and Sanjay Dutt, actor Anil Kapoor said, "I won't say best friends. I am not so presumptuous that I am anybody's best friend." "I think we just respect...[and] love each other," added Anil. Anil and Ranveer starred together in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do' which also featured Anushka Sharma.

300.title: I took this job to change Twitter for the better: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal
300.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday tweeted, "I took this job to change Twitter for the better, course correct where we need to, and strengthen the service." "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus and urgency despite the noise," he added.

301.title: Man dupes over 170 people in investment scam in Mumbai, booked
301.article_body: Mumbai police have booked a man for duping over 170 people on the pretext of an investment scam. According to an FIR, the complainant, son of Vastu consultant Biindu Khuraana, said his family had invested around ₹60 lakh in 2020. Though, they initially received good returns, months later, they stopped receiving the money following which they approached police.

302.title: 3 members of Punjab-based gang held for uprooting ATM in Kurukshetra
302.article_body: The Kurukshetra Police arrested three members of a Punjab-based gang for allegedly uprooting an ATM containing ₹18.41 lakh cash from Shahbad in Kurukshetra earlier this month. Two members of the gang are absconding. The accused uprooted the ATM with the help of an SUV and took it along on the intervening night of April 8 and 9.

303.title: Guj woman injured after husband wanting her to quit studies assaults her
303.article_body: A woman was injured in Gujarat's Rajkot after her husband, who wanted her to not pursue her further studies, assaulted her. He also stopped her from going to get her examination hall ticket. The woman reportedly pleaded with him to let her complete her second year, after which, she said she'd quit studies but the husband abused and assaulted her.

304.title: BMC completes 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai
304.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai, senior civic officials said on Wednesday. The civic body further aims to complete about 65% of work by May 15. Moreover, BMC is also creating a website with real-time data on desilting work in order to maintain transparency between citizens and the civic body, officials said.

305.title: J&K's Mughal Road reopens after remaining closed for over 4 months
305.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Mughal Road which connects Rajouri and Poonch districts of Jammu region with Shopian district of south Kashmir reopened for vehicular traffic on Wednesday. The road remained closed for over four months due to heavy snowfall in the area. Jammu's Divisional Commissioner ordered the reopening of the road, which was cleared of snow by the Mechanical Engineering Department.

306.title: Baidu, Pony.ai get 1st permits to deploy driverless robotaxis in China
306.article_body: Baidu and Pony.ai have received permits from Beijing city authorities to deploy their robotaxis without a safety driver, marking the first time such permits have been given in China. Both the firms are allowed to offer rides to the general public on open roads within a 60 square kilometre area in the Beijing Economic and Technological Development Area.

307.title: Delhi govt to develop 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan
307.article_body: Delhi government is planning to develop a 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Wednesday. "Development of conforming areas such as Jhandewalan will help the government generate employment opportunities by promoting labour intensive  manufacturing and service industrial activities," Sisodia said. The plan is a part of schemes announced under Rozgar Budget.

308.title: US & Russia swap prisoners amid Ukraine war tensions
308.article_body: The US and Russia on Wednesday swapped prisoners amid their most tense relations in decades over the Ukraine war. Ex-US Marine Trevor Reed, held in Russia since 2019, was exchanged for Russian pilot Konstantin Yaroshenko, who'd been serving a 20-year sentence for conspiring to smuggle cocaine into the US. Reed was jailed for assaulting two Russian police officers in Moscow.

309.title: Had a hole in my heart, blood clot travelled from that hole to my brain: Hailey
309.article_body: While talking about her hospitalisation in March, Hailey Bieber said that she experienced stroke-like symptoms from a "blood clot that traveled from a hole in her heart to her brain". Bieber added that tests revealed that she had a mini-stroke. She underwent a procedure to close the hole, which she says was between 12 and 13 millimetres.

310.title: 3 dead, 6 injured in Unnao after car overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
310.article_body: At least three members of a family, including a six-month-old girl, were killed and six others were injured after a car overturned and was hit by another vehicle on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway, police said. The car was going to Gonda from Rajasthan and it jumped to the other lane and overturned before being hit by another car, police added.

311.title: UP has set an example by removing unnecessary loudspeakers: CM Yogi
311.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has set an example before the country by removing unnecessary loudspeakers installed at religious sites or reducing their volumes across UP with harmony. "Instructions given for the use of loudspeakers should be implemented strictly. The people should not face inconvenience and loudspeakers should not be installed at new sites," CM Yogi added.

312.title: Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way: P Chidambaram on SRH pacer
312.article_body: After SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul against GT, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "The Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way...The sheer pace and aggression is a sight to behold." Adding that Umran is the find of IPL 2022, Chidambaram suggested BCCI should give him an exclusive coach and "quickly" induct him into the national team.

313.title: I'm not in favour of Umran being included in India's T20 WC squad: RP Singh
313.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said he's not in favour of SRH pacer Umran Malik being included in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Umran is surely an exciting talent...But playing him right away? I'm not in favour...because he hasn't played much domestic and even in IPL, he has only just started to do well," explained Singh.

314.title: Why should govt suffer loss of face because of your negligence?: Mamata to police
314.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the state's police force saying that their "negligence" led to incidents of violence and rape. She said, "Why should the government have a loss of face because of your negligence?" This comes after nine people were burnt alive in Birbhum and a minor girl was allegedly raped by a TMC leader's son in Nadia.

315.title: Wrote poem for Big B, got letter he wrote next day: Runway 34 actress Aakanksha
315.article_body: 'Runway 34' actress Aakanksha Singh said that getting a handwritten letter from actor Amitabh Bachchan was a "very big deal" for her. She said she wrote a poem for the actor after he sent her a buggy when she had a fracture. "He had written...You will keep getting appreciation letters. But first, please accept this letter," Aakanksha added.

316.title: Improvised scene by putting nail paint on fingers: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
316.article_body: When asked if he was apprehensive about playing a feminine guy 'Laila' in 'Heropanti 2', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he was looking for a role that is "villainous" and "feminine" at the same time. "There's a scene where I'm putting nail polish on my fingers, it wasn't a part of the script initially, but I improvised it," he added.

317.title: Feels good, happy to deliver against SRH: Rashid Khan on 31*(11)
317.article_body: GT's Rashid Khan, who smashed unbeaten 31 runs off 11 balls on Wednesday, said he's happy to deliver against SRH. He added, "[I'm] just trying to play my game and have that belief [in] my batting which I'm working [on] for the last two years." Rashid smashed three sixes in final over to help GT chase down SRH's 195-run total.

318.title: UK govt proposes seizing crypto assets to help against economic crime
318.article_body: The UK government has proposed seizing crypto assets to help combat economic crime. It told the parliament's Treasury Select Committee that the creation of a civil forfeiture power would "mitigate the risk posed by those that cannot be prosecuted but use their funds to further criminality". The parliamentary inquiry recommended creating a single body to tackle economic crime.

319.title: Skulls found by Mexican police from AD 900, not a crime scene
319.article_body: A pile of about 150 skulls found in a Mexico cave in 2012, which the police believed to be a crime scene, turned out to be over a thousand years old. According to archaeologists, the skulls belonged to sacrificial victims killed between AD 900 and 1200. They said the victims were likely decapitated and their skulls put on display.

320.title: Expel me if you want me to join BJP: Shivpal to Akhilesh
320.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark that why was the BJP delaying induction of Shivpal Yadav, the latter said that if Akhilesh wanted him to join BJP then he should expel him from the party. "It's an irresponsible and childish statement. I'm one of 111 MLAs of SP who won in recent assembly elections," Shivpal said.

321.title: 36-yr-old property dealer held for killing 2 men in Prayagraj
321.article_body: A 36-year-old property dealer was arrested for allegedly killing two men involved in the sale and purchase of properties in Prayagraj's Dhoomanganj area on Wednesday, police said. The accused shot dead both the men after they had an argument over a property deal at the former's residence. The deceased and the accused were known to each other, police added.

322.title: UP govt removes 10,900 'illegal' loudspeakers from religious places
322.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government said it has removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places across the state on Wednesday. "There's an existing 2018 order...there are set rules for sound decibel limits and court directions," it added. "Focus is to ensure the implementation of guidelines through dialogue, making everyone understand the norms through awareness," UP Police said.

323.title: Satyajit Ray did posters, music for films out of compulsion: Shoojit Sircar
323.article_body: Talking about late Indian filmmaker Satyajit Ray, director Shoojit Sircar said, "Ray is called a multi-talented director but this may be out of compulsion." "He [made] his own posters because probably he thought others won't realise it...the same way. Ray did music in his films as he wasn't sure...he could explain the context...in its entirety to another person," added Shoojit.

324.title: Mumbai court acquits builder, 4 police officials for planting drugs on agent
324.article_body: A special court acquitted a builder and four Mumbai Police officials, who were booked for planting drugs and a weapon on an estate agent. In 2004, 340 grams of heroin and a weapon were seized from the agent by Dongri Police. After the agent spent 150 days in jail, a probe revealed that he was falsely implicated by the accused.

325.title: 5 persons booked for attempted murder in Ludhiana after assaulting couple
325.article_body: Five persons were booked in Ludhiana for attempted murder after they assaulted a 23-year-old man and his wife with a baseball bat and a sword. The incident occurred on April 24, when the accused first assaulted the man over a verbal spat. Later, when his wife came to his rescue, the accused also assaulted her, according to the male complainant.

326.title: Astronauts launched by SpaceX reach International Space Station
326.article_body: The Crew-4 astronauts launched by SpaceX reached the International Space Station at 5:07 am IST on Thursday after a journey of nearly 16 hours. While three astronauts - Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins - are from NASA, the fourth - Samantha Cristoforetti is from European Space Agency. NASA said it was one of the fastest flights to the ISS.

327.title: Petrol will be cheaper if states cut taxes on fuel instead of liquor: Petroleum Minister
327.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday tweeted, "Petrol will be cheaper if opposition ruled states cut taxes on fuel instead of imported liquor!" He added, "Maharashtra govt imposes ₹32.15/ltr on petrol & Congress ruled Rajasthan ₹29.10. But BJP ruled Uttarakhand levies only ₹14.51 & Uttar Pradesh ₹16.50." He further wrote, "Protests cannot challenge facts!"

328.title: Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed: Pietersen on Umran taking 5 wickets
328.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the way ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar celebrated in the commentary box after SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul was "more exciting" than the dismissals. Pietersen added that Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed. "I think he did that because how often have we seen India producing the fastest bowler in world cricket?" Pietersen stated.

329.title: North stars are jealous of south stars after KGF 2's success: Ram Gopal Varma
329.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn recently took offence to Kiccha Sudeep's "Hindi is not our national language" comment. Reacting to it, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took Sudeep's side and wrote, "The base undeniable ground truth @KicchaSudeep sir, is that the north stars are insecure and jealous of the south stars because a Kannada dubbing film #KGF2 had a ₹50 crore opening day."

330.title: Got attention in childhood; people clapped & whistled, I got addicted: Yash
330.article_body: Actor Yash said that he used to participate in a lot of cultural activities in his childhood. "I used to get that extra attention...people used to clap and whistle. So I think I got addicted to it at a very young age," he added. Yash further said that he always wanted to be a hero and never had plan B.

331.title: I didn't like how villains treated my mom in films: Mandakini's son Rabbil
331.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini's son Rabbil Thakur said he did not watch any of his mother's films during his childhood, as he did not like watching them. "I used to not like seeing the way villains treated my mom. I [did not]...understand the concept that this is just a movie and she is just acting," added Rabbil.

332.title: SRK throwing T-shirts not act of negligence: HC on 2017 stampede incident
332.article_body: Gujarat High Court has quashed a criminal complaint against Shah Rukh Khan, observing that the actor throwing T-shirts and smiley balls at Vadodara railway station in 2017 while promoting 'Raees' cannot be termed acts of "high degree of negligence". According to the complaint, Khan threw the items at the crowd, which resulted in a stampede and death of a person.

333.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid throwing cap in anger resurfaces after Muralitharan's outburst
333.article_body: After Muttiah Muralitharan got angry and shouted in frustration during SRH's defeat against GT, fans recalled Rahul Dravid throwing his cap in anger during IPL 2014. Dravid, who was RR's mentor at the time, threw the cap after their defeat against MI. "Only tournament in the world that can make Dravid and Muralitharan lose their calm," a fan tweeted.

334.title: US govt's religious freedom body criticises India; Hindu council calls it 'Indophobic'
334.article_body: After US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) recommended to the US administration to designate India and 14 other nations as "country of particular concern" in the context of status of religious freedom, HinduPACT said USCIRF has been taken over by "Indophobic and Hinduphobic members". "Many of these members have attended India and Hindu bashing events," HinduPACT added.

335.title: Maha man asked to shut up after fight with wife slaps constable, held
335.article_body: Kongaon Police arrested a man for slapping constable following fight with his wife. The accused tried to break the main door after thumping on it, after which, his wife got scared. "Our constables...brought...man to the police station...he started abusing police officials...when he was asked to shut up...he slapped...a constable and pushed others who tried to stop him," an officer said.

336.title: Truck speeds away for kilometres with toll official standing on bumper in Andhra
336.article_body: A video went viral showing a truck speeding away on a highway in Andhra Pradesh with a toll official standing on its bumper. As per reports, the driver was asked to pay a fine after which he sped away. The worker was reportedly scanning FASTag by standing on the bumper. The truck was reportedly stopped by police after several kilometres.

337.title: India reports 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 39 deaths in 24 hours
337.article_body: India has reported 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 2,563 recoveries and 39 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,927 COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,980, while the death toll rose to 5,23,693.

338.title: US judge rejects Musk's bid to end Tesla tweets review under SEC deal
338.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's bid to end the condition to have his tweets on Tesla vetted by a competent lawyer before posting, a requirement under his US SEC deal. Musk has claimed he was forced to agree to the deal. The judge said Musk's free speech argument against the deal is "meritless" and "particularly ironic".

339.title: 2 youths arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars in Pune
339.article_body: Two youths have been arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars and selling their parts in Pune. According to police, the duo "would extract catalytic converter from these cars and extract the crushed material that has components of expensive elements". "We are yet to nab the person to whom they sold these elements," Loni Kalbhor Police Station officials said.

340.title: Need control over Delhi as it is the face of India: Centre to SC
340.article_body: Centre told the Supreme Court that it needs to have control over administrative services in Delhi as the world views India through its national capital. "It's necessary...Centre has powers over appointments and transfers of public servants. Delhi is the face of the nation," it added. SC was hearing petitions by the Delhi government against the Centre's control of civil services.

341.title: Fire breaks out at Chennai’s Rajiv Gandhi hospital, no casualties reported
341.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Chennai's Rajiv Gandhi government hospital around 11 am on Wednesday. "This was an unexpected accident which happened due to...short circuit," Health Minister Ma Subramanian said after visiting the spot. No injuries or casualties have been reported. Earlier, four fire tenders were rushed to the spot and more joined later to douse the fire.

342.title: India not part of climate problem but will play big role in solution: Union Minister
342.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Wednesday said India is not a part of the climate problem but it wants to be and will be a big part of the solution. "To address climate change, technology transfer is necessary…India is among few G20 countries that have fulfilled its nationally determined contribution (NDC) under the Paris Agreement," Yadav stated.

343.title: Don't think Hardik Pandya will bowl a lot now in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
343.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya, who hasn't bowled in his last two games, is unlikely to "bowl a lot" in their upcoming matches as the team has got all their bases covered. "GT will take care of Hardik and [he'll] only bowl if needed to...they've Lockie [Ferguson], [Mohammad] Shami, and Alzarri Joseph," explained Jaffer.

344.title: J&K Army-run school asks staff to avoid hijab; official clarifies
344.article_body: An Indian Army-run school in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla asked its staff to avoid wearing hijab during school hours. This triggered a controversy with several political leaders opposing the move. Following this, Defence spokesperson Emron Musavi clarified that the circular mistakenly mentioned hijab instead of 'niqab' [a veil which covers the entire face except for eyes].

345.title: Central Railway allows co-branding rights to stations in Mumbai division
345.article_body: The Central Railway has allowed private companies, corporates, banks and government agencies to brand their names in 83 stations, which includes almost all stations of Mumbai division to generate non-fare income. "We are in the bidding process right now. We have received interest from private companies for a few railway stations of Palghar and Dahanu," a Western Railway official said.

346.title: I'd love to work with Aishwarya, I enjoy working with her: Abhishek on wife
346.article_body: When asked if he would like to work with his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, anytime soon, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "I'd love to collaborate with her again, but obviously, it has to be the right script at the right time." Speaking about his wife as an actor, Abhishek said that she is wonderful and he enjoys working with her.

347.title: Delhi Police busts fake arms licence racket, 4 people arrested
347.article_body: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has busted a fake arms licence racket and arrested four persons.
