Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap and apprehended one person accused of carrying illegal arms. On further investigation, the other three accused were also arrested. About 15 fake arms licences, purportedly issued from Jammu and Kashmir, were recovered from the accused.

348.title: He has been bowling beautifully: Williamson on Umran's 5/25 vs GT
348.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson praised pacer Umran Malik for his performance against GT, stating that the 22-year-old is bowling beautifully in the tournament. "It was an outstanding performance [against GT]," he added. Umran picked a five-wicket haul in the game, conceding 25 runs. SRH lost the match after Rashid Khan smashed three sixes off Marco Jansen in the final over.

349.title: Karnataka reports 126 new COVID-19 cases; 114 in Bengaluru alone
349.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 126 new COVID-19 cases out of which 114 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also recorded 92 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 3.06%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Notably, with the new cases, the total number of active coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has risen to 1,648.

350.title: Guj teacher arrested for derogatory WhatsApp post against minority
350.article_body: A school teacher was arrested in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against a minority community on WhatsApp. The police said the accused, Manisha Bhavsar, "was part of several WhatsApp groups where she had shared and saved posts that were derogatory against the Muslim community". "After technical surveillance and investigation, the accused was arrested," added police.

351.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised gambling racket, 7 held
351.article_body: Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police busted an organised gambling racket in Yousufguda's Sri Krishna Nagar area. Acting on credible information, police conducted a raid and arrested seven accused persons, including the (gambling) organiser. The organiser used to invite punters, who have the habit of gambling by betting money and gaining easy money illegally, Banjara Hills SHO said.

352.title: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak cleared of ethics breach over wife's non-dom status
352.article_body: UK Chancellor Rishi Sunak has been cleared by PM Boris Johnson's ethics adviser of breaching ministerial rules over his wife Akshata Murty's non-dom status and the green card granting him residency in the US. The independent adviser Christopher Geidt said Sunak had declared his interests correctly and had been "assiduous in meeting his obligations and in engaging with this investigation".

353.title: Ex-Twitter CEO tells Musk 'bullying isn't leadership', he reacts
353.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo reacted to Elon Musk's response to Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde reportedly crying over his takeover and expressing concerns, saying, "Bullying is not leadership...You're making an executive at the company you just bought...target of harassment." In response, Musk said, "What are talking about? I'm just saying Twitter needs to be politically neutral."

354.title: India built ties with Russia out of necessity as we couldn't do it earlier: US
354.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "Russia, for India, was out of necessity a partner of choice when we were not in a position to be a partner." "Now, we are investing in that effort. I think there is a growing strategic convergence between the United States and India," Blinken further said.

355.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 40 matches?
355.article_body: Following the conclusion of 40 matches in IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 14 points. RR are second on the points table with 12 points. They are followed by SRH, LSG and RCB, who have 10 points each. MI, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are placed last on the table.

356.title: Muralitharan shouts in anger during last over of SRH-GT match, video goes viral
356.article_body: SRH's strategy and spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan was seen shouting in anger when GT vice-captain Rashid Khan smashed SRH pacer Marco Jansen for a six in last over of their IPL 2022 match. Muralitharan stood up from his chair and purportedly said, "Why the f**k is he bowling full?" Jansen conceded 25 runs in the over as GT won.

357.title: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
357.article_body: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."

358.title: Farmers send mango stock to Pune due to rains, prices slashed by 25%
358.article_body: Farmers from Konkan belt have started sending mango stock to Pune Market Yard due to unexpected rains. In last week, over 10,000 boxes of Alphonso mangoes have arrived in Market Yard. Due to increase in supply, prices of these mangoes have been reduced by at least  25%. Sale of mangoes is also increasing as Akshaya Tritiya is approaching.

359.title: 2 men die after falling into sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana
359.article_body: At least two men died after falling into a sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana area on Wednesday, officials said. The men were working near the spot when the accident took place, officials added. "The firemen pulled out the men...sent them to the Maharishi Valmiki Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) chief Atul Garg said.

360.title: SRH's Umran Malik records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
360.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik on Wednesday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 22-year-old pacer recorded figures of 4-0-25-5 against GT, registering his first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket. The previous best bowling figures of IPL 2022 (4-0-40-5) were recorded by RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal against KKR on April 18.

361.title: 2-year-old boy dies after being attacked by stray dogs in Hyderabad
361.article_body: A two-year-old boy died after being attacked by a pack of stray dogs in Hyderabad, reports stated. The boy was playing near his house when the dogs attacked and dragged him to adjoining military area on Tuesday night. Meanwhile, locals have alleged that Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) failed to act though stray dogs pose a grave threat to them.

362.title: GT smash 4 sixes in last over to beat SRH on last ball, reclaim top spot on points table
362.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets to reclaim the top spot on the IPL 2022 points table. GT chased down the target of 196 on their last delivery. Needing 22 runs in the last over, GT smashed four sixes and scored 25 runs to complete the chase. Rashid Khan slammed an unbeaten 31 off 11 deliveries.

363.title: COVID-19 situation in Karnataka is under control: CM Bommai
363.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. He added that 2% of international passengers will be randomly tested and teletracking of passengers coming from Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and South Korea will be carried out. Samples of hospitalised patients who are COVID-19 positive will be sent for genome sequencing, he added.

364.title: Imran Khan begged Pakistani army till last minute to save his govt: Maryam Nawaz
364.article_body: Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan was so desperate that he "begged" the military establishment till the last minute to save his government, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz has claimed. "He had even requested former President and PPP co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari to help him in the wake of a no-confidence motion against him," Maryam said.

365.title: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
365.article_body: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.

366.title: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
366.article_body: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.

367.title: He removed his bag to accommodate Viv's bag: Vivek Razdan on Kohli's gesture on flight
367.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan recalled how Virat Kohli once removed his own bag from the overhead locker of a flight in the Caribbean to accommodate the bag of ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards, who was unable to find space. "Kohli...kept his bag below the seat ahead of him," Razdan added. "Richards tapped his shoulder and thanked him," he further said.

368.title: IAS officer booked after IRS officer wife's dowry harassment allegation in MP
368.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have filed a case against an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer after his wife accused him and his family members of dowry harassment. Police said that the woman is an Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. “Based on the complaint, a case was registered against the IAS officer, his mother and sister for dowry harassment,” police said.

369.title: 'Major' to release on June 3, will clash with Akshay's 'Prithviraj'
369.article_body: Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' has been postponed again and now will release on June 3. Previously, the film was slated to release on May 27. However, the actor announced on Twitter that the release has been pushed by a week. The film's release date had earlier been postponed due to the pandemic. The film will now clash with Akshay Kumar's 'Prithviraj'.

370.title: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
370.article_body: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

371.title: Bomb threat letter found at railway station in Punjab's Kapurthala
371.article_body: A bomb threat letter was found at Sultanpur Lodhi Railway Station in Punjab's Kapurthala on Wednesday, ANI reported. The letter mentioned that major railway stations like Sultanpur Lodhi, Ferozepur and Jalandhar will be blown up by May 21 to avenge, ANI quoted the Station Master as saying. It also reportedly mentioned that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will also be attacked.

372.title: ₹1 lakh ex-gratia to those severely injured in Thanjavur incident
372.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met those who were injured in the Thanjavur electrocution incident and announced ex-gratia of ₹1 lakh to those severely injured and ₹50,000 to the injured. "It is a tragic and painful incident. We have ordered officials to take action on this issue," he said. Eleven people were killed and 15 were injured in the incident.

373.title: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
373.article_body: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

374.title: Man Utd's Rangnick accepts top-four finish in PL is not 'realistic'
374.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick accepts that a top-four finish in the Premier League this season is not "realistic" ahead of their Premier League clash with Chelsea on Thursday. United are currently sixth on the table with 54 points with four games left. "Even if we win all four games, it's still not in our own hands," Rangnick said.

375.title: Australian minister accuses China of interference ahead of federal polls
375.article_body: Australian minister Karen Andrews on Wednesday suggested that China deliberately announced its security pact with Solomon Islands ahead of Australian federal polls in a bid to derail Liberal Party's re-election. She further claimed that China wants the Labor Party to win elections. Notably, Labor Party has claimed that Australian government's inability to stall pact is a foreign policy failure.

376.title: India has one language, which is entertainment: Sonu Sood on national language debate
376.article_body: Sonu Sood spoke about the ongoing debate on whether Hindi can be considered the national language of the country. "I don't think Hindi can be called just the national language. India has one language, which is entertainment," he said. "It doesn't really matter which industry you belong to. If you entertain people, they will love you...and accept you," Sonu added.

377.title: Danish teenager Rune beats world no. 3 Zverev in Munich
377.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune on Wednesday beat world number three Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-2 at the ATP 250 tournament in Munich. "I have a lot of respect for him, and I obviously didn't expect to win in two sets, and with a score like this," the 18-year-old said. Rune's victory over Zverev is his first against a Top 10 opponent.

378.title: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
378.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.

379.title: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
379.article_body: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.

380.title: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
380.article_body: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.

381.title: Web space gave me visibility like never before: Sikandar Kher
381.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher has said the OTT platform gave him visibility that he never got before. "As an actor, you need and want people to see your work and your abilities," he stated. "When you get that many eyeballs, filmmakers also get the chance to view you in their projects and the characters they create," Sikandar further added.

382.title: We need to take more chances: Foden on CL SF clash with Real Madrid
382.article_body: Phil Foden admitted Manchester City needed to "take more chances" after their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. City won 4-3 despite having a two-goal advantage on three occasions. "It was a great game. End to end. We started really well and could have killed them off. In these games, we need to take more chances," Foden said.

383.title: World no.1 Swiatek withdraws from Madrid Open with shoulder injury
383.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek has withdrawn from the Madrid Open due to a right shoulder injury. "I need a break from playing so intensively in order to treat my arm well and that's why, unfortunately, I have to withdraw," the 20-year-old said. Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak after winning her fourth consecutive title in Stuttgart on Sunday.

384.title: Finnish, Swedish security services warn of Russian interference amid NATO bid
384.article_body: Finland and Sweden must be vigilant of Russian spy operations and cyber attacks as they consider NATO membership bid, nordic countries' intelligence chiefs said on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid reports that the countries may apply to join alliance in May. Russia has warned of deploying nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in Baltic enclave of Kaliningrad if they join NATO.

385.title: No longer good enough to supply defensive weapons to Ukraine: Truss
385.article_body: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said it is no longer good enough for Britain to supply only defensive weapons to Ukraine against its war with Russia. "For too long, there was a false distinction between defensive and offensive weapons. It became an excuse for some to drag their feet. That time has now passed," she said.

386.title: EU tiggers rule of law mechanism against Hungarian government
386.article_body: The EU on Wednesday launched its rule of law mechanism against the Hungarian government that could strip Hungary of its EU funding. The mechanism allows the EU to withhold funds from member states if they are found to have committed violations against the EU's democratic standards. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen criticised "corruption" in Hungary earlier this month.

387.title: Won't do too many dance numbers, it's a matter of being typecast: Regina
387.article_body: Actress Regina Cassandra, who has a dance number in 'Acharya', said she would not do too many of them in the future. "A few years ago, I was offered a song with Chiranjeevi. After that, I got many more offers to do item numbers," she stated. "Makers felt...why can't I do it in another? It's...matter of being typecast," Regina added.

388.title: Paying for Russian gas in roubles breaches sanctions: EU chief
388.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said paying for Russian gas in roubles would breach sanctions imposed on Russia. "We have about 97% of all contracts that explicitly stipulate payments in euros or dollars," she said. Unless a supply contract was denominated in roubles, European firms should not accede to Russia's demands, she added.

389.title: 1 dead, 24 missing after migrant boat capsizes off Canary Islands
389.article_body: Authorities said a boat carrying 61 migrants capsized off Spain's Canary Islands leaving one person dead and 24 missing. Spain's marine services rescued 36 people, including two minors and 10 women, and recovered the body of a woman. A spokeswoman said three boats in total were intercepted. A total of 116 people were rescued from the other two boats.

390.title: 36th Russian colonel killed in Ukraine since invasion began
390.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Oleg Yevseev is the 36th Russian colonel to be killed in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. Russia did not provide details on how or when he died. Yevseev was a commander of the 291st Artillery Brigade of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. At least 36 colonels and eight generals have died so far.

391.title: COVID-19 is now at an endemic stage, not pandemic: Mexican govt
391.article_body: The Mexican government said COVID-19 is no longer a pandemic but has passed to an endemic stage in Mexico. "It is now retreating almost completely," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said. Mexico has recorded almost 325,000 COVID-19 related deaths since the pandemic began, although government reviews of death certificates suggest the actual death toll could be about 490,000.

392.title: GT's Lockie Ferguson bowls most expensive 20th over in IPL 2022
392.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson on Wednesday bowled the most expensive 20th over in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 25 runs against SRH. Ferguson was hit for four sixes in the over, out of which three were hit by Shashank Singh. Ferguson recorded bowling figures of 4-0-52-0 in the match.

393.title: 14-yr-old gets pregnant after being raped by 5 Russian soldiers, plans to keep the baby
393.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is pregnant after being raped by five Russian soldiers in Ukraine, said reports. The teenager, from Bucha, plans to keep the child after doctors warned if she had an abortion now she may not be able to have children again. Her story has been shared by psychologist Oleksandra Kvitko, who is helping her accept the child.

394.title: Ukraine still in control of majority of its airspace: UK
394.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Ukraine remains in control of the majority of its airspace as Russia has failed to "effectively destroy" Ukraine's air force. They said Ukraine's air defences have also not been "suppressed" by Russian forces which first invaded Ukraine on February 24. "Ukraine continues to hold Russian air assets at risk," they added.

395.title: Will take considerate view on crypto, it can't be rushed: FM
395.article_body: The government will take a considerate decision on cryptocurrency regulation but it can't be rushed through, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. However, she added that the government is open to promote innovation made in the distributed ledger technologies. "Our intention is in no way to hurt this (innovation around crypto)...but (we need to) define for ourselves," she stated.

396.title: Rashid Khan records his 3rd most expensive spell in IPL
396.article_body: GT leg-spinner Rashid Khan on Wednesday recorded his third-most expensive spell in IPL. The 23-year-old gave away 45 runs against SRH, registering figures of 4-0-45-0. Rashid was hit for three sixes and two fours in his spell. Rashid's most expensive spell in IPL had come on April 19, 2018, when he conceded 55 runs against PBKS while representing SRH.

397.title: US considers imposing sanctions against Putin's alleged girlfriend: Reports
397.article_body: The US is reportedly considering imposing sanctions against Alina Kabaeva, the woman it believes is Russian President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend and mother of at least three of his children. The WSJ claimed that earlier, the US spared Kabaeva from Russian sanctions in a "last-minute" decision. Russia's 38-year-old politician Kabaeva is a retired Olympic gold medal winner in rhythmic gymnastics.

398.title: Travis Scott to publicly perform for 1st time since Astroworld tragedy
398.article_body: Travis Scott will be performing publicly for the first time since the Astroworld tragedy that took place in November last year and killed 10 people. The rapper will be performing in Miami on May 7 at E11even during the 'Race Week' ahead of the F1 Grand Prix race. E11even's website has begun the sale for the tickets for Scott's event.

399.title: 26-yr-old woman beats 3-yr-old son to death in Raj, arrested
399.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly beating her three-and-a-half-year-old son to death in Chhipabarod town of Baran district, police said. The woman beat her son at their house bolting the room from inside, Chhipabarod Police Station SHO Ravinder Singh said. The accused was arrested after her husband, Anil Jatav, filed a police report against her.

400.title: McLaren's Ricciardo apologises to Ferrari's Sainz after 1st lap crash
400.article_body: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo apologised to Ferrari's Carlos Sainz after causing a collision in the first lap of the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Ricciardo finished the race in 18th place. "Obviously not the way I wanted Sunday to go. A painful one and obviously not the way I want to affect somebody else's race," Ricciardo said.

401.title: Destroyed 'large batch' of Western-supplied arms in Ukraine: Russia
401.article_body: Russian forces have destroyed a large quantity of foreign weapons in southeastern Ukraine with long-range missiles, the country's defence ministry said on Wednesday. According to the ministry, the destroyed weapons were supplied by the US and European countries for Ukrainian troops. This comes after the US and 40 other nations held a security summit to discuss arms supplies to Ukraine.
